casebody.data:
George Langdon, Plaintiff v. The New York Book Company, Defendant. Decided January 11, 1892. Appeal by receiver from order denying motion to vacate order granting John B. Alden leave to sue receiver. Straley, Hasbrouck & Schloeder, attorneys, and Frederic R. Kellogg of counsel, for respondent Alden. Dill, Chandler & Seymour, attorneys for George H. Stonebridge, Jr., the receiver, appellant.

Before Freedman, P. J., and Gildersleeve, J.

Per Curiam.

Order affirmed, with $10 costs’ and disbursements to be paid by the receiver.
